It may be possible that you have both a prolactinoma and Cushing's syndrome at the same time. It is not common, but it does happen. It happened to me. I had the prolactinoma on the right side and the Cushing's tumor on the right. I know of two others that have had the same.The purple striae are pretty much a dead give away. I also had Hashimoto's, PCOS, and gosh so much going on that the docs would find one thing, think this was IT and stop and I would just get worse (sorry!) when my hormones were just all over the place.I suggest that you find a neuro-endocrinologist at a large pituitary center and get comprehensive testing. The dex test may come back as *normal* but you may still have Cushing's - many of us have so if you are not with an experienced doctor, you may be told that this is a test of exclusion whereas it more helps show source (pituitary vs adrenal). The diabetes is probably related to the cortisol. If you are cyclical or have a high cortisol binding globulin, testing can be off. Medicines as well as lab error can all play a role as well. ACTH and renin are very fussy tests.I had to see a lot of doctors (I was not aggressive enough as I was told to ignore my pituitary tumor - bad bad bad advice) and finally got help 12 years later. I had to have pituitary surgery and later, my adrenals removed.
